title: Would a vector field layer be a welcome addition?
body_html:
Here is a paper I stumbled upon yesterday. It describes an interesting, visual approach of separation of mixed set of points in high dimensional spaces into linearly separable set of points by learning a vector field that carries input points to new locations.

Coupled with Tensorboard, such a layer would provide intuition as to what the network is doing. We would "see" how it warps the space to provide linear separability.

I have started coding up such a layer to run some visualizations. Note that this would be a first contribution to the code base, so excuse any dumb things as I am learning the code base.
and I am wondering if anyone wants to collaborate on the implementation, and if upon successful implementation and tests, such a layer could be accepted into the code base.

Here is a [paper](https://arxiv.org/pdf/1802.08235v1.pdf) I stumbled upon yesterday. It describes an interesting, visual approach of separation of mixed set of points in high dimensional spaces into linearly separable set of points by learning a vector field that carries input points to new locations.

Coupled with Tensorboard, such a layer would provide intuition as to what the network is doing. We would "see" how it warps the space to provide linear separability. 

I have started coding up such a layer to run some visualizations. Note that this would be a first contribution to the code base, so excuse any dumb things as I am learning the code base. 
and I am wondering if anyone wants to collaborate on the implementation, and if upon successful implementation and tests, such a layer could be accepted into the code base.
